headline: French sports goods seller Decathlon to double India sourcing to $3 billion in 5 years
summary: Decathlon, which entered India in 2009, sells a host of sports accessories ranging from footballs and yoga mats to bicycles and exercise equipment in the country, cashing in on the growing interest in fitness and an active lifestyle.  It competes with Nike, Adidas, Puma and local brands in India's sports goods market, which is expected to grow 69% to $6.6 billion from 2020 to 2027, according to industry estimates.  The company said it will create more than 300,000 direct and indirect jobs in India over the next five years.

The company said it will create more than 300,000 direct and indirect jobs in India over the next five years.

headline: S&P Futures Gain With Focus on U.S. JOLTs Report and Corporate Earnings, FOMC Meeting on Tap
summary: September S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESU25) are trending up +0.24% this morning, extending yesterday’s gains, while investors shift their focus from recent U.S. trade deals to economic data, a new round of corporate earnings reports, and the start of the Federal Reserve’s two-day policy meeting.
